review: Great option for simple streaming. Compact and out of the way. Keep it plugged in vs USB'd for fast response.
author: 919 Move

review: Flawless functionality on the home network, this will change the way you use your TV.  I prefer it over Chromecast.
author: The Aviator

review: If it could actually stay connected to the internet this would be an awesome product! (And actually I don't even know if that's the issue because it says it's connected when you check the connection). All I know is I've spent almost as much time dealing with connection issues as I have watching movies or shows. This happens with Netflix, Amazon Prime and Hulu Plus which tells me it's a device issue and not an app issue. I've known older Roku products to have this issue but I was hoping that had been solved in the newer versions!Overall I'm really disappointed with this product and will be returning it unless I can figure out how to solve the connection problem.
author: Ash Cox

review: If you are into watching movies or just want to catch up on some TV shows. Then this is the one you want to buy. I own both the Roku and the chrome cast and both are fantastic and both have their strengths. I bought this Roku for my mother and it is a very easy device to set up and use. Where there Crone cast might be for someone more Technology inclined the Roku is definitely something that can be used by the novice.
author: Don C Reedy

review: Bought it stream Netflix to the new HDTV in my living room. Works perfectly, no buffering. Also has HBO, Showtime, and streaming HD music apps. I can take my Roku with me anywhere I go that as TV with an HDMI port and WiFi.  Love and recommend!
author: my alias

review: I bought the Roku streaming player for the TV in our den. It worked fine for the most part, although I did have to unplug the power cord from time to time to 'unfreeze' the screen. I bought the Roku stick (less noticeable because it doesn't have the player) for the den and moved the streaming player to the bedroom. All I get with the stick is the opening Roku screen. Nothing happens when I try to use the remote.
author: bd

review: I tried setting up my account then it asked for the password on my tv screen.  No password anywhere! Then I tried going into Netflix which I am a member of and it asks me for a 4 digit passcode which I couldn't find either.  I followed all directions, so then I decided to try the reset button.  Tried it 4 times and it just kept getting stuck on the same screen.What a piece of garbage!  Maybe mine was just defective but Roku didn't leave me with a good first impression.  I took it back and purchased Chromecast.  I had Chromecast up and running in literally 5 minutes.
author: shawn

review: So happy with this product.  Addicted to Netflix and I have big beautiful HDTV and this makes it a smart tv for peanuts. Squeeeee..2nd one I bought.
